greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle read by rows: T(n,k) (0 <= k <= 2^n-1) = number of binary strings of length n such that the smallest number whose binary representation is not visible in the string is k.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..15, flattened
formula: For row 3, here are the 8 strings of length 3 and for each one, the smallest missing number k:
mathematica: notVis[bits_] := For[i = 0, True, i++, If[SequencePosition[bits, IntegerDigits[i, 2]] == {}, Return[i]]];
T[n_, k_] := Select[Rest[IntegerDigits[#, 2]]& /@ Range[2^n, 2^(n+1)-1], notVis[#] == k&] // Length;
xref: See A261019 for a more compact version (which has further information about the columns).
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Aug 16 2015
ext: More terms from _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 17 2015
